steps.name: Start Axon.ivy Designer
instructions: Download the Axon.ivy Designer, switch to the installation directory and start Axon.ivy Designer.exe
Click OK to continue with the default Workspace'
Leave the Welcome Screen by clicking Go to workbench

steps.name: Create your first project
instructions: Open the New Axon.ivy Project wizard with the menu File > New > Axon.ivy Project
Enter 'MyProject' as Project Name and close the wizard by clicking the Finish button.

steps.name: Create a Business Process
instructions: Open the New Process wizard with the menu File > New > Process
Enter 'MyProcess' as Name and close the dialog by clicking first the 'Next >' and then the 'Finish' button.

steps.name: Draw your process
instructions: To draw a process from scratch delete the auto-generated process elements.
Click once on the Start item in the palette at the right side of the Process Editor.
Place the start item somewhere on the upper left corner in the Process Editor by clicking on the editor grid.
Expand the Activity category within the Process Editor palette
Place the User Dialog item next to the Start Request.
Expand the Event & Gateway category within the Process Editor palette.
Select the Process End item and place it next to the User Dialog activity.
To connect the Request Start with the User Dialog click on the Request Start and hold your mouse button pressed, move to the User Dialog activity and release the mouse button there.
Connect the User Dialog activity and the Process End event likewise.
Press Ctrl+S to save your changes in the process.

steps.name: Execute the Process
instructions:
Start the Process Engine by clicking the 'Start Engine and show Overview Page' button in the top toolbar.
  • The Web Browser view appears right to the Process Editor and displays all startable processes.

Click on the MyProcess/start.ivp link in the Web Browser view to start the execution of the process.
  • A red circle will visualize the process execution in the Process Editor.
  • In the web browser view an auto user dialog will be shown.

Finish the process execution by clicking the Proceed button in the shown web page.
  • The red ball then flows to the Process End.

Congratulations! You have just drawn and executed your first process!
You can now proceed with Tutorial 2 >

steps.name: Edit Process Data
instructions: We will continue with the project you created in Tutorial 1
Expand the Data Classes folder of your project within the Axon.ivy Projects view. Then expand the myProject folder inside of the Data Classes folder.
Double click on the Data node inside the expanded folders to open the Data Class Editor.
Click into the Name column within the first row of the Attributes table. Type Type 'product'
Press Enter to navigate to the next row.
Create a second attribute with the name 'releaseDate'.
Change the attribute type to Date.
Enter 'price:Number' into the Name column of the third attribute. (This way you define the attribute name to price and its type to Number at once.)
Press Enter to confirm your input.
Press Ctrl+S to save your changes of the Data Class definition.

steps.name: Create an User Dialog
instructions: Open the process 'MyProcess'
Double click on the User Dialog activity to open it's inscription mask.
Type 'Enter product' as Display name.
Switch to the Call tab
Click the 'Create new User Dialog' button to open the New User Dialog wizard.
Type 'EnterProduct' as Name and navigate to the next wizard page by clicking on the 'Next >' button.
Select In, Out and UI on the data Process Attribute.
Press Finish to close the wizard and OK to close the inscription mask.

steps.name: Execute the process and explore process data
instructions: Start the Process Engine and then click on the link MyProcess/start.ivp to start the process.
Enter some data in the appearing Enter Product Html Dialog and click Proceed.
Open the process editor for the process 'MyProcess' again.
Click on the Process End event to select it.
Bring the History view to front by clicking on it's tab (It is located inside the bottom right section of the window).
Check if the arrived process data matches your input from the last process execution.

steps.name: Add an Alternative
instructions:
In your 'MyProcess' process place an Alternative Gateway between the Enter Product User Dialog activity and the Process End event.
  • Ensure that you place the Alternative Gateway directly on the existing arc so that the process elements will be auto connected.
Add a second Process End event below the existing one.
Also connect the Alternative with the second Process End event.
Open the inscription mask of the Alternative Gateway.
Enter 'Price higher than 100?' as Display name.
Switch to the Condition tab. Put the cursor into the first condition row.
Enter 'in.price > 100' and leave the inscription mask with the OK button.
Double click on the first arc that leaves the Alternative Gateway. Enter 'Yes' as Description and confirm with OK.
Describe the second arc with 'No'.
Press Ctrl+S to save your changes.

steps.name: Test Alternative Condition
instructions:
Execute the process a few times and vary the product prices in the Enter Product User Dialog.
  • Does the Alternative Gateway behave as expected?
Congratulations! You've just created and executed your first user dialog!

Want to know more?

  • Use the Axon.ivy Community to get community support.
  • Import the HtmlDialogDemos project found in the applications/samples/ folder of your unzipped designer.
